Activation of this Emergency Response Plan sets in motion a pre-planned series of events that notify all area emergency response agencies. Emergency response agencies are notified on the 911 system. All agencies and personnel respond to predetermined staging areas with representatives from each agency reporting to the Central Command Post. A contingency plan is developed and executed using trained industry personnel along with other emergency response personnel from responding agencies, as needed.
All Channelview CDU employees are provided a copy of the Emergency Response Plan when initially hired. In addition, all CDU operators have had the appropriate emergency response training as required by the OSHA standard. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
Diligent compliance with the Risk Management Program forms the framework on which we will continue to improve the level of safety at Channelview CDU. Some of the key components of the safety improvements we expect to achieve are as follows: We are in the process to implement a new muster point badging process to allow us to quickly determine any unaccounted-for employees or contractors upon a facility evacuation.
Hartree has recently employed a full-time training coordinator who will be working with new hire and current employees to ensure consistent training at all experience levels.  All employees will begin the process of not only being qualified for their current position but will be trained on other positions within the facility.

distillation technology to separate crude oil into products of LPG, naphtha, kerosene, diesel, and atmospheric tower bottoms. There are five LPG storage tanks in quantities greater than the threshold of 10,000 pounds which subjects the facility to the Risk Management Program Level 3 requirements. The crude oil is received by pipeline and stored on-site until being processed through the CDU. All products are stored on-site until the LPG can be loaded onto trucks, naphtha sent out by pipeline or barge, and other products being loaded onto barges. We have communicated the potential LPG releases with our employees and with local emergency response officials in Harris County, thereby further reducing the possibility of any impact on the public.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
The facility complies with the USEPA’s Risk Management Program and the OSHA PSM. Process safety information is readily available to all affected employees. Channelview CDU keeps a variety of technical documents that are used to help maintain safe operation of the process. These documents address chemical properties and associated hazards, limits for key process parameters and specific chemical inventories, and equipment design basis/configuration information. These programs include PHA, written operating procedures, training, addresses contractors, Pre-Startup Safety Review processes, mechanical integrity of the equipment, safe work practices, management of change, incident investigations, and compliance audits. 

Five-year Accident History:
No incidents resulting in on-site or off-site impacts from an LPG accidental release has occurred at Channelview CDU within the last five years.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY - CHANNELVIEW CDU
The Channelview CDU, owned and operated by Hartree, is a crude oil distillation unit located in Channelview, Texas. Channelview CDU is committed to the same brand of safety and environmental excellence that all other Hartree company assets promote. This philosophy involves making each and every employee and contractor accountable for their own safety, as well as that of the community around them. As a company, we follow a close adherence to all applicable federal, state and local laws to ensure a safe and healthy environment for all. Most importantly, we stress our commitment to ensuring a safe operation of our facility for our employees, our visitors, and our community.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Channelview CDU facility has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training and consideration of safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the processes. The Channelview CDU policy is to implement controls to prevent foreseeable releases of hazardous chemicals. However, if a release does occur, the trained personnel will respond to control and contain the release. Employees who enter the Channelview CDU facility complete a thorough training, both in the classroom and on-the-job, that enables them to address emergency issues as they arise. This preparation includes standard operational, emergency operational and release prevention training. In addition, periodic refresher courses help to keep operators’ problem-solving abilities up-to-date and in sync with recurring safety improvements. We conduct regular internal audits which provide excellent checks and balances system for monitoring these high standards that we set.
